alert.note: Alert for San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 01 at 9:44AM MDT until July 01 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible, especially over and below the Bear Trap and Black burn scars. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands. In west central New Mexico, Southwest Mountains. * WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain from slow moving storms will be capable of producing 1-2" rainfall amounts over the Bear Trap and Black burn scars in less than one hour. This type of rainfall would produce dangerous flash flooding including potential debris flow. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southwest Mountains
